titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the R.S. Strader "Public Sale" broadside, 1884 April 25 2012ms742
titlestmt.author: Ash Pechon

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The R.S. Strader Public Sale broadside (dated 1884 April 25; 0.01 cubic feet; 1 items) comprises a broadside announcing the sale of a two and a half story home on Nicholasville Pike in Lexington, Kentucky.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Colonel Robert S. Strader (1836-1891) owned a farm in Boone County where he was a horse breeder before moving to Lexington, Kentucky, to operate a stable and the Lexington trotting track. He was a horse dealer before starting R.S. Strader and Son distillers with his son Wilson Peter Strader in 1890.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2012ms742: [identification of item], R.S. Strader Public Sale broadside, 1884 April 25, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: 73M29, Robert Simms Strader papers, 1864-1955, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The R.S. Strader Public Sale broadside (dated 1884 April 25; 0.01 cubic feet; 1 items) comprises a broadside announcing the sale of a two and a half story home on Nicholasville Pike in Lexington, Kentucky.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.
